data.title: Oh mab
data.text: Fish looked a little old for me.  I walked in and walked out.  Sorry guys, gotta be more fresh for me.

data.title: Overprice not fresh sushi and dirty outdated environment
data.text: I must say I am highly disappointed in Fuji Bay. As a sushi lover this place failed on all levels. Sushi bar doors kept open with selections tossed around in a carless disgusting manner. Prepared without gloves or washing of hands. Prices are much higher than other places in Sioux City. Decor is unkept and outdated. Sushi tasted ok but was definitely not fresh. Service was decent but nothing special. Highly unrecommended

data.title: Can you say "Sushi and Saki!" ?
data.text: Really, the only place in town for fresh sushi. Fun place, would be good for taking clients to for dinner. Good downtown location, parking sometimes is difficult if there is a show next door...

data.title: Fuji Yama in Sioux City, fresh Japanese style food
data.text: A surprising find is available in the center of Sioux City. Only a block away from the Orpheum this tiny corner of Japan provides a fun and tasty culinary experience. It is our favorite spot to quench our physical thirst before we embark upon satisfying our emotional thirst at a concert by Sioux City Symphony Orchestra. Bento box is my favorite  featuring salmon accompanied by tempura veggies. There are several other options, but I always go for the box. It is an ample and a pleasant meal which will not overfill you, and leave a spot to enjoy the concert.

data.title: LOVE IT!
data.text: Besides having the sushi, you have to have a "lunch box."  They are really really good and would highly recommend it if you are going there for lunch.  Plan on spending an hour for lunch.

data.title: Our Very Favorite
data.text: Fuji Bay may well be one of the best kept secrets in Sioux City.  Located on 6th Street in the downtown area, it is a favorite of those of us who know about it.  Authentic, serving freshly-made food, intimate, quaint-truly a gem.  Expect to spend a little extra time at this amazing restaurant because the food is cooked at the time of your order, not before. A great place to take guests if you want something special!

data.title: The only place in Siouxland for real sushi.
data.text: Not the best sushi I have ever had,  and not a wide variety, but what is served is of good quality.  A clear coice compared to Bamboo Sushi or mall sushi.

data.title: 1.5 hours and still didn't have our food!
data.text: This has to be one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant.  I ordered a box and my husband a couple pieces of sushi and a roll.  After 45 minutes we received my order.  After a couple minutes, I went ahead and started to eat so that my teriyaki didn't go cold.  I finished my meal and my husband had still not received his order.  When we asked the server she said she couldn't find "him" and that the order hadn't even been started.  This was after 1.5 hours!!!!!  We paid and left without him ever eating.  There was no offer to try and make it right.  We will NOT be back.  Save your time and money and go elsewhere.

data.title: Not Overstated
data.text:
Fuji Bay does serve sushi but we found it average when compared to other fresh fish sushi restaurants. 

No greeting at the door even though the Sushi Chef was actively working away at the fish cooler beside us. This did give us plenty of time to review the menu and decide whether to take a chance eating here or heading out of this area as quickly as possible.

Based on high ratings of other diners, we decided to stick with our plan. 

The location seems to be in a bit of a sketchy area if the local street people are any indication. We stopped into this downtown location on a workday and the sidewalks were devoid of anyone who appeared to be minimally employed in gainful work. As a visitor to Sioux City, perhaps this is how downtown works but, if so, it's depressing to the point that it perhaps influenced our feelings about eating in the area. 

The soft shelled crab was fairly fresh and nicely cooked and presented. This was the high point of the meal. The sushi styles were presented well but not of notable quality so cannot be recommended. Beer was cold which is always a plus.

The decor is small town restaurant-esque with residential kitchen tables and chairs. No feeling of a sushi operation is presented or even attempted to imply something special is going on.

Not sure why there are so many places like this that deliver the bare minimum to be average but perhaps the public isn't demanding better quality in product, surroundings, and service. I won't recommend establishments that do not work for a recommendation and barely do the minimum to meet the basic requirements of their business. Although it qualifies as average when compared to comparable sushi restaurants, this is yet another place that cannot be recommended for a sushi dining experience.

data.title: Love it
data.text: Really great. Amazing choices. Loved the enviroment. The loaction is annyoing. The food is made fresh. There was not a single item I did not like.

data.title: Not for the non-sushi eater
data.text: While we knew this place was highly rated for its sushi, we did not realize that there are very few non-sushi options.  And, unfortunately, the ones we chose were rather bland.  If you don't plan to order sushi, I'd suggest looking elsewhere.

data.title: Hidden gem in Sioux City
data.text: We've lived here in Sioux City for almost 3 years, and had never tried Fuji Bay until recently.  I'm so sad we missed out those 3 years!  The Sushi here is fresh and there are interesting choices alongside the usual offerings at a sushi restaurant. We love to order 3-4 rolls and share, but you can order your own entrée too.  friendly, if slow service, I've never seen more than one server in this approximately 12-table restaurant. Go early for a table.

data.title: Great evening out.
data.text: This was a great evening out.  A real surprise to find it almost hidden away. The food was delicious and well presented.

data.title: Great sushi
data.text: The sushi is fabulous. The tempora, edamame & Mizo soup are amazing. High end food for reasonable prices. Staff is nice.

data.title: Very good.
data.text: edamame is very good and the rolls are yum. I like the bento box also.  You will need to have time for leisurely dinner though.

data.title: Excellent Sushi
data.text: Their sushi is fabulous.  We have travelled a fair amount and seldom find sushi as good.  Who knew it could be found here?  :)

data.title: very good sushi
data.text: this is a high quality place, food and service are always top notch.  If you are a true sushi and sashimi lover then this is the place for you.  This place is as good as any sushi restaurant I'm been to in HI and that is a statement.

data.title: Mediocre At Best.....
data.text:
After two nights of steak in a row, we decided to try some sushi on the final evening of a business trip. Common logic would say not to get sushi in Sioux City, Iowa, and that logic would be correct!

The selections were pretty pedestrian - some standard rolls and the typical offerings of nigiri and sashimi (tuna, salmon, yellowtail, etc...) Plus they only had one type of sake and incorrectly assumed that we wanted it hot. Okay - it's not exactly Tokyo or NYC (or even Cleveland) - so all of that could be forgiven if the sushi were fresh, tasty and served with a smile. Unfortunately, none of that was true. 

The sushi chef was impossible to communicate with (he wore ear buds the whole time) and amazingly showed great disrespect for the sushi - throwing it onto the plates and carry out containers instead of carefully putting it into place. The sushi bar fridge was a discombobulated mess - all different types of fish sloppily piled on top of one another. I think this guy would have been jailed in Tokyo!

The rolls were not well made, the sashimi and sushi unevenly sliced - and none of it was all too fresh or tasty. It kind of reminded me of what a run-down Chinese restaurant trying to cash in on the popularity of sushi would come up with.

Why not just one star? The place was relatively clean and the wait staff (despite their poor knowledge of sushi) were very nice. But if you have had even average sushi in any major city you will be disappointed. My suggestion - have steak three nights in a row!!

data.title: Great Sushi
data.text: Great sushi but service sucks. Don't go if you don't have a couple of hours to spend.

data.title: Best sushi ever
data.text: The Philadelphia rolls are the best. They are like crack once u eat one u just can't stop. Highly recommend.
